title: 110_hr288
content: The "Notch Baby Act of 2007" establishes a new guaranteed minimum primary insurance amount for individuals eligible during a transitional period. Section 215(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for individuals becoming eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1978 and 1989, ensuring a transitional increase amount is added to their primary insurance amount. The Social Security Act amendments provide transitional increase percentages for individuals becoming eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1979 and 1988. The excess under former law is calculated as the difference between the former law primary insurance amount and the recalculated amount under the new provisions. The transitional increase percentages for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1979 and 1988 are determined by comparing the former law primary insurance amount with the recalculated amount under the new provisions. The applicable former law primary insurance amount is defined as the individual's primary insurance amount under the law in effect in December 1978, modified as provided. The primary insurance amount for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1979 and 1988 is determined by comparing the former law amount with the recalculated amount under new provisions. The calculation includes specific criteria for computation base years and adjustments to ensure accurate benefits. The paragraph discusses applying specific adjustments to calculate the primary insurance amount for individuals eligible for old-age insurance benefits between 1979 and 1988. SEC. 3. EFFECTIVE DATE AND RELATED RULES. The amendments made by this Act are effective as if they were part of the Social Security Amendments of 1977, with no benefit increases before January 2007. Recomputation of benefits is required for individuals entitled to benefits in December 2006 based on specific criteria. The Commissioner of Social Security will recompute the primary insurance amount for individuals entitled to benefits in December 2006 based on specific criteria, taking into account the amendments made by the Act.
